movesets.name: Defensive

items.name: Eviolite
items.description: Boosts Defense and Special Defense of holder by 50% if it is an NFE Pokemon.

movesets.description:
Moves

This is Shellos's best bet for taking advantage of its unique strengths. Scald is a reliable STAB move and carries a useful burn chance, allowing Shellos to better wall physical attackers. Recover is essential to Shellos's walling capabilities by providing reliable recovery, allowing Shellos to remain healthy. As a coverage move, Earth Power is the preferred option because it allows Shellos to switch into and easily beat Croagunk and Pawniard that lack Swords Dance , while also hitting Chinchou and Magnemite on the switch, but Ice Beam deals decent damage to frailer Grass-types on the switch as well as hitting the occasional Dragon-type. The final moveslot is best dedicated to one of Shellos's supportive options; Toxic cripples certain switch-ins such as Lileep and Porygon, but does not synergize well with Scald's burn chance. On the other hand, Clear Smog helps prevent Shellos from being setup bait against sweepers such as Tirtouga and Scraggy, whereas Yawn allows Shellos to force more switches, although it does not synergize well with Scald, either.

Set Details

Sticky Hold should be Shellos's ability because it is what gives Shellos its main niche, allowing it to absorb the omnipresent Knock Off. Eviolite gives Shellos acceptable bulk, and it cannot be removed by Knock Off thanks to Sticky Hold. With the given EVs, which hit Eviolite numbers, Shellos is able to reach respectable defensive stats of 27 HP / 21 Defense / 21 Special Defense.

Usage Tips

Because Shellos is able to maintain its Eviolite-boosted bulk, it is able to switch in on the likes of Mienfoo and Pawniard and wall them with relative ease, provided that they don't have a means of boosting their Attack. Scald is the most spammable move because Shellos can try to cripple switch-ins with a burn, but keep in mind that, unless it's hitting for super effective damage, Shellos is usually fairly weak. Do not attempt to switch into extremely powerful attacks, because Shellos's defenses are still breakable. If using Shellos as your sole answer to a certain Pokemon, ensure that Shellos is always healthy enough to absorb two of their attacks because Shellos is quite slow.

Team Options

Shellos is best used on defensive teams; it should not be used on an offensive team because its entirely defensive nature means it will make the team lose momentum. Pokemon that are particularly impeded by Knock Off, such as Spritzee and Abra, make good teammates. In fact, anything that especially dislikes Pawniard, such as Spritzee or Lileep, will appreciate Shellos's presence. In terms of Pokemon to help support Shellos, Ferroseed beats the Grass- and Electric-types that plague Shellos while Shellos is able to withstand the Fire-type attacks aimed at Ferroseed. A cleric such as Spritzee or Lickitung can help with Shellos's susceptibility to Toxic. Shellos's typing and movepool allow it to fit into a variety of defensive teams as a bulky Water-type and a switch-in to Knock Off.

moves.name: Acid Armor
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Amnesia
moves.description: Boosts Special Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Ancient Power
moves.description: 10% chance to boost all stats by 1 stage.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Blizzard
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Brine
moves.description: Base Power doubles if foe's HP is 50% or less.

moves.name: Captivate
moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Clear Smog
moves.description: Eliminates the target's stat changes.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Counter
moves.description: If hit by a physical attack, returns double the damage.

moves.name: Curse
moves.description: Does 1/4 of max HP damage per turn at the cost of half the user's max HP if the user is a Ghost. Boosts Attack and Defense and lowers Speed by 1 stage otherwise.

moves.name: Dive
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Earth Power
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Fissure
moves.description: Will OHKO the target.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Hail
moves.description: Summons hail for 5 turns.

moves.name: Harden
moves.description: Boosts user's Defense by one stage.

moves.name: Headbutt
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch the target.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Ice Beam
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze the target.

moves.name: Icy Wind
moves.description: Lowers foe's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Infestation
moves.description: Traps and damages target for 4-5 turns.

moves.name: Memento
moves.description: User faints. Lowers foe's Attack and Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Mirror Coat
moves.description: If hit by a special attack, returns double the damage.

moves.name: Mist
moves.description: Prevents moves that lower stats from working for 5 turns.

moves.name: Mud Bomb
moves.description: 30% chance to lower accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Mud Sport
moves.description: Electric-type attacks do 50% damage.

moves.name: Mud-Slap
moves.description: Lowers accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Muddy Water
moves.description: 30% chance to lower accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Natural Gift
moves.description: Power and type depends on the user's held Berry.

moves.name: Pain Split
moves.description: Averages both Pokemon's HP.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Recover
moves.description: Heals 50% of user's max HP.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Scald
moves.description: 30% chance to burn the target. Thaws the user.

moves.name: Secret Power
moves.description: Effects vary with terrain.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Sludge
moves.description: 30% chance to poison.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Spit Up
moves.description: Varies in power depending on the number of uses of Stockpile.

moves.name: Stockpile
moves.description: Sets the user up to use Spit Up and Swallow.

moves.name: String Shot
moves.description: Lowers foe's Speed 1 stage.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Surf
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Swallow
moves.description: Healing varies based on the number of uses of Stockpile.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Trump Card
moves.description: Power increases as PP decreases.

moves.name: Water Pulse
moves.description: 20% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Whirlpool
moves.description: Traps and damages target for 4-5 turns.

moves.name: Yawn
moves.description: Puts the target to sleep after 2 turns.

abilities.name: Sand Force
abilities.description: Increases power of Ground-, Rock-, and Steel-type attacks by 30% in a sandstorm.

abilities.name: Sticky Hold
abilities.description: This Pokemon's item cannot be removed. Increases the chance of encountering Pokemon while fishing.

abilities.name: Storm Drain
abilities.description: All Water-type attacks target this Pokemon. Grants immunity to Water-type moves and boosts Special Attack by 1 stage when hit by a Water-type move.
